newsitem.title: UK: McCann-Erickson unveils new UK condom ad campaign.
newsitem.headline: McCann-Erickson unveils new UK condom ad campaign.

text.p: Britain's London Rubber Company, the makers of the 'Durex' condom brand, is launching a three-month advertising campaign for a range of fruit-flavoured condoms, which will feature in youth-oriented magazines only.

The ads for strawberry, orange and banana flavoured, coloured condoms -- which use separate images of the different fruit to refer to a penis -- will run in popular British women's, men's, music and other youth interest magazines, McCann-Erickson, the ad agency behind the campaign, said on Friday.
Ads for other flavours and colours -- including ice tea -- will be introduced at a later date.
The choice of media is designed to avoid offending an'older and more conservative' readership, said Sharon Gallacher, account director at McCann-Erickson.
"This is not shock advertising...It is intended to be fun, topical and relevant to the age group. Shown out of context, I am sure the press ads would provoke a strong reaction," she said.
The drive is part of London Rubber's attempt to maintain market share in an increasingly competitive marketplace.
